intro: Deyeuxia breviglumis, commonly known as the short-glume sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers, typical of many sedges. It thrives in wet or moist environments, often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Deyeuxia breviglumis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
